title: Stage profiles
text:
Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



This is the best opening stage profile I think we’ve ever had. Lots of climbing, except that final hill just isn’t hard enough for the pure climbers. My best guess would’ve been Wout in yellow, but he comes into this year well and truly underdone…

title: Stage profiles
text:
Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



This is the best opening stage profile I think we’ve ever had. Lots of climbing, except that final hill just isn’t hard enough for the pure climbers. My best guess would’ve been Wout in yellow, but he comes into this year well and truly underdone…

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 2







Terrain type



Punchy








Zings summary



The Italian start continues with a miny Giro dell’Emilia. The climb to the Sanctuary of Saint Luca is tackled twice and, while short, super steep. This was Alaphilippe’s terrain back in the day, but now it’s Pog pog pog (seriously it’s worth emptying the isaver account).

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 3







Terrain type



Sprinty








Zings summary



First chance for the pure sprinters. Expect lead-out train carnage.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 4







Terrain type



Extreme mountain








Zings summary



Holy shit the Galibier this early. Jonas, Remco and Primoz better hope those last minute altitude camps paid dividends. Luckily for them, this is the shallow side of Galibier.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 5







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



I reckon we’re sprinting again. Give the break a slight chance.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 6







Terrain type



Flattest








Zings summary



Who’s the best sprinter here? All signs point to a Belgium battle royale between Philipsen and Merlier.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 7







Terrain type



Time trial








Zings summary



Remco is the most aerodynamic man on the planet and this is the perfect course for him. If he’s serious about yellow, we need to see him put 45 secs + into all his rivals.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 8







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



More pure sprinting. Get some sleep.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 9







Terrain type



Gravelly








Zings summary



A heavier sprinter is likely here, as the stage isn’t that hard. Some flimsy GC pretender will crash out today (looking at you Enric).

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 10







Terrain type



Even flatter








Zings summary



God there seems to be a lot of sprinting at the front end of this tour. Could Cav finally break the Mercx record?

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 11







Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



This is a really hard mountain stage. I don’t expect them to be big, but there should be gc gaps today.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 12







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



More sprinting. Maybe we should prioritise sprinters…

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 13







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



See above.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 14







Terrain type



Huge mountain








Zings summary



Big kilajoules day before a very hard final climb. Kilajoules burnt positively correlates with gc gaps so circle this one on the calendar. A Jonas day if he has the shape.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 15







Terrain type



Large mountain








Zings summary



Nothing will happen here until the final climb because of the long valleys that separate the mountains. This is the first stage I think the breakaway is likely to win.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 16







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



I don’t have much left to say about sprinting, so lets briefly mention some outside stage candidates. In no particular order there’s Pedersen, Bennett, Bauhaus, Groenewegen and Jakobsen.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 17







Terrain type



Transition stage








Zings summary



Get in the break fellas.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 18







Terrain type



Transition stage








Zings summary



If you missed the break yesterday, you’d want to get in today.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 19







Terrain type



Queen stage (stupid mountains)








Zings summary



Circle this one. Look how high Bonette is! This stage is so important that all the rich teams held their altitude camps at Isola this year. It’s also the place where Pog’s greatest weakness - climbs over an hour after big kilajoule expenditure - should get taken to task. He showed great improvement in this area at the Giro, but there was no one there that could truly challenge him. Jury;s out on whether the tour will be any different.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 20







Terrain type



Extreme mountains








Zings summary



The final battle for yellow and the dots. Plenty of raid potential. If the time gaps are close this could be awesome. It’s worth quickly talking about the teams here: UAE and Bora bring the best climbing teams to a tour since 2012 Sky. UAE is so stacked that a 1, 2, 3 on gc is a real possibility. Bora bring Hindley, Roglic and Vlasov who should all be top 10 level at worst.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 21







Terrain type



Mountain TT








Zings summary



No Champs this year because of the Olympics. Instead, we get a brutal time trial. Is it to much to hope for a Pogacar style inspirational comeback a la 2020?
